result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashton Drake Sivrais

records.addlTxt: 11:06AM  Defendant Ashton Drake Sivrais not in court.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear for the scheduling conference today.  State sent offer back on July 25, 2022 and has not received a response.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.  Any cash bail previously posted will be forfeited unless within 30 days good cause is given for missing court.

11:34 am - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashton Drake Sivrais in court.  Defendant will be filed PFAC forms.  Not guilty plea.  Jury calendar.  Bail is set at $100.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances.  Bail furnished.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

RE:  Possess THC, on 05-07-22.
Initial appearance is set for 07-21-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15
